name: Privacy and Security Capstone
long_desc: This course is the capstone course for the Privacy and Security concentration in Information Systems.  It requires students to engage in a substantive project related to Privacy andor Security that will be primarily independent but guided by faculty.

custom_fields.goals: 1.Synthesize and apply the principles of Information Systems.2.the knowledge, skills, and abilities related to Privacy and Security.3.Demonstrate the ability to apply the learning from throughout the major and concentration to a substantive project
custom_fields.key_topics: This course is the capstone course for the Privacy and Security concentration in Information Systems. It requires students to engage in a substantive project related to Privacy and/or Security that will be primarily independent but guided by faculty.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Completion of at least two IS concentration courses and enrolled concurrently in a third
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Assessments in this course could typically include class discussions, debates, research reports, presentations, assignments, homework, quizzes, case studies, and a term project. Assessments adopt an individual perspective and a team perspective. Refer to the course outline for specific details.
custom_fields.relevance: The course is relevant to all students in the Privacy and Security concentration as it acts as the synthesis of the material learned throughout there is program and concentration.
custom_fields.learning_resources: The learning resources primarily consist of textbooks, scholarly articles, industry reports and case studies, as well as online materials.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: This is a 9 unit course. On average, a student is expected to spend 9 hours a week on this course, consisting of 2.5 hours in class and 6.5 hours of self-study
